text: Favorite place to have a meal/drink in Streeterville. Been here many, many times and both food and service have always been excellent.

I went here quite a bit when I lived in Streeterville a few years ago. I think sometimes D4 gets the spill-over from people not being willing to wait at Yolk, but honestly I think I like D4 better. They have good crispy breakfast potatoes and you don't have to wait forever for an overpriced omelet like Yolk (see my review for there). Plus it's Irish and everyone loves the Irish. Lots of drink options, chill atmosphere, and nice outdoor seating.

Rude woman next to us berated my friend about his posture at the table. Instead of handling the situation properly the manager kissed her ass. The food was overpriced and horrible. Will gladly never eat at this dump again
Would not recommend. It took about an hour to get one round of drinks for 3 of us; and it was not very busy. The bar atmosphere and music was chill, but sadly service was subpar. :(

I was expecting them to have big, crispy fries, but instead the fries came out like McDonalds Fries. I guess don't order the fries....the drinks and food are good though. People are nice. If you order a burger, you better believe you're going to get a burger. If you order chicken fingers, you're going to get super crispy, bad for you buttery fingers with interesting sauces(I actually threw it up after, from the weird combinations). I still liked the chicken fingers. I'll try the pot pie next with a salad as the side. If I suggest something I'd say get Parmesan chips with a good dip.
Great service, waiter was polite, kept drinks full, had great input on the menu. Lamb chops were perfect, cooked to order.
Just came for drinks and real Irish charm in an upscale setting.  Nice outdoors seating too.
Everything about this place is amazing. Bar staff is great and the food is phenomenal.  Taco Tuesday is a must!!!

I love D4 and feel totally comfortable going alone ... this was my second visit .. and I sat at the bar . Wait staff is friendly .. lots of neighborhood regulars and a few tourists . Great location and wonderful Atmosphere

This restaurant was excellent. We arrived in Chicago later in the afternoon on Wednesday. Our waiter was Jimmy and he took care of us as soon as we receive it which was immediately. I ordered the chicken pot pie, and my family had the fish tacos, but the letter, and the lobster macaroni and cheese. Every dish was delicious and flavorful. There were many beers on tap including several local Chicago breeze. The Chicago blonde it was tasty. Great atmosphere and five. Filled with locals as well as Tourists.

Stumbled on this place this past Sunday.  There was a long line at a breakfast place next door and saw a brunch flag on front of this restaurant.  Holy cow was the food good.  Our party had french toast (yum), pancakes and omelettes.  Everything was flavorful and yummy.  Outdoor patio was a delight.  Skip the long line next door and try this place!

Tried to go here for happy hour tonight with a few friends. One of my best friends is not from the United States and therefore carries a British drivers license instead. She's 23 years old and D4 refused to serve her alcohol. The manager explicitly stated that he would not accept any non American form of identification . Needless to say we cancelled our order and left. This is pure discrimination and is ridiculous. I was a fan of D4 prior to this but will never go back.
great food and service. drinks were great and the brunch food was awesome and big portions. the beer battered chicken fingers are our favorite
Love this place. 3rd time here. The look/vibe and food. (I've only had breakfast tho so my ranking is only a.m.)

Friendly service but I asked for my steak medium, it came out well; I sent it back and they brought the same steak back with a phone light saying that if I look at it in the light I could see that it was medium. Never again.

I never have written a Yelp review but my whole table just walked out after the waiter just told me she wouldn't serve me out of our whole table. She clearly was discriminating, none of us had a drink before we walked in. I called the manager who was this yuppy guy with a beard, and he said he has to stand behind his inexperienced waitress. Sorry you lost our business and a got a bad review. None of us will ever come back, & clearly you weren't busy on a Saturday night to be closing down sections before midnight. ‍

This is my favorite pub in Chicago -- grilled cauliflower, reasonable salads, and sweet potato fries.  I wish they were more transparent with ingredient lists--they sneak a lot of sugar into dishes that could do without it.  And bring back the khale slaw offered with specials.  This is great and should be a menu item.

Food: The food and drinks are above average.  The grain salad is especially good. Rating: Four stars Service:  The service is average.  The bar area has better service than the inner seating area. Rating: Three stars Atmosphere: The bar area is near windows and it is lively.  The inner seating area has long padded bench seats that have cushions that move every time someone sits down or stands up. Rating: Two stars Location: The location is close to hotels and is a good option. Rating: Four stars

Went here with some girlfriends for a morning brunch. Ended up getting the bloody mary after a wild night, and wasn't really impressed. Wish I didn't pay the money for it... but anyways... the food was delicious. I definitely recommend the burger! The bartenders were super nice and super cute as well! :) I'll probably return, but would just leave out the bloody mary!

The food was outstanding. I had the chicken pot pie and the thing was loaded with chicken and just the right amount of vegetables, the English peas in it were deliciously sweet. My wife had the pulled pork and burger sliders, she loved them.  We also had the short rib nachos as an appetizer and they were wow, good! They could be a meal by themselves, succulent sweet meat and veggies that just rocked!   The only issue we had was the table was tiny and cramped. The water served wasn't cold either, but it is a must stop place for the food and beer selection, if you are a drinker. Our server was Estelle and she was the best. Very attentive to our needs and we had no issues with being taken care of.

D4 is my go-to place when I want to eat out close to home or meet a friend for lunch. The food -- comfort dishes done really well -- offer no surprises, which is a good thing. They are consistently really good and fresh, with a lot of flavor. And the ambiance feels so good, with cozy fireplaces on grey winter days and outdoor seating next to a garden on summer days. They also cater, which I intend to take advantage of. D4 is like having a favorite relative who's also a good cook; you feel at home there and the food's just right.
My date and I went to there for drink today. I like this place. Next time, I'll going to be there again!

This place is 2ft from my home in streeterville so it's very convenient. Nice outside seating, nice selection of food vs some other Irish pubs, prices are decent. Good place to sneak into when everything else is crazy busy. Nice happy hour, they have real Irish coffee (duh) and brunch. Hit up a week night for a fun place to beat the crowds.

One of the best dining experiences I have had recently. The restaurant wasn't busy, so the service was above average. I ordered the Kale and Grapefruit salad adding shrimp. It was wonderfully fresh, with a lot of tasty and healthy ingredients. A basket of bread featuring the Irish brown bread was brought to the table right after we ordered. I look forward to return visits.

Love D4! I've been here many times and have always had a super positive experience. They have a great beer menu, if that's your thing, but also a wonderful cocktail and even "mocktail" menu. The atmosphere is cozy yet elegant, the restaurant is spacious, the waiters are always nice, and they even have outdoor seating! For food I have tried the ancient grain salad (literally one of the best salads I have ever had), fish tacos (again on point and go great with a beer or cocktail), veggie burger, and curry fries. Everything is always delicious. I also like that the menu is a little bit different than your typical bar food menu and they offer twists to classic dishes, including unique ingredients (I am officially a fan of crispy garbanzo beans :)). I will be back for sure.

The food here is always pretty good, but it can get pretty pricey! The ambiance is good, and the service has been very good as well in my experience. They have a pretty good drinks menu as well. This is a great place to relax, have a few drinks, and hang out with friends.

Staying downtown Chicago one week a year I always find myself at this place.  Generally because it's right by the hotel my company stays at.  Really nice beer list though and a pretty good atmosphere.  This year I tried the fish and chips while dinning with a group of 12.  Really tasted great and was a great meal.  Man is it greezy though so don't order it if you are watching calories.  Also, I'm not very experienced with Irish bread but the bread served here is like chewing sawdust.

Location is very good, the patio area is nice but too small.  Nice views of the courtyard that connects both Golub high rises. My wife and I split the Large dish of the Fish and Chips. Tasty and hot right out the fryer, however the batter was WAY TOO THICK, and as a result it was crispy on the edges but SOGGY on the inside.  Maybe next time I'll just ask them to go light on the batter, not sure if that would be a problem for them to make it that way but I sure will ask next time. The cole slaw was off from what we are used to, it tasted a little on the expired side (or maybe they just changed the recipe) one or the two. The French fries  were excellent and just the way we like them (not over cooked and just the right amount of salt).  We come here often but it had been a while since we last ordered the fish and chips. We do like the fact that they give us a 10%discount with the neighborhood discount card from Golub Connect. Although other places do 15%, but it's nice to have a little kick back for supporting our neighbors.
Excellent food, great service.  The passion fruit mule was amazing. They have plenty of food options as well. Great place to go with a group.

My go to spot! Of course it helps its right across the street from my home. But this place is a true "Cheers" bar. D4 has that classic Chicago feel with the dark wood bar top and the community vibe amongst the guest. Whether coming in for dinner or drinks for a social hour or grab Togo I always enjoy myself. Lawrence is awesome and always very genuine in his engaging and Britney has become my other favorite. She is always smiling! A great addition to the team!  Keep it up D4

Unexpected delight! When the wait at Yolk was an hour, we opted to keep walking and saw the brunch sign out front. Holy cow!!! New favorite! Bloody Mary was out of this world and the homemade jam is unbelievable. New favorite breakfast spot!
D4 is the best Irish pub and owned by an Irish guy :) Staff is fantastic alway friendly. Would highly recommend anything on the menu bartenders are the nicest people and the managers all say hi.

D4 is a great spot to grab a beer and a burger in the neighborhood (especially for $10 on Mondays!), but I want to give them a shoutout for their high quality brunch in this review.  The challah bread French toast is one of the best I've ever had. It's super light and fluffy, but also really rich and eggy. The fresh berries add a nice touch of freshness and some necessary tartness. I also really love their breakfast potatoes: rather than your typical hash browns or boring diced potatoes, D4 serves these really yummy fried potatoes (think chips but thicker). They are a real treat-- I like mine dipped in ketchup. Try D4 for brunch, you won't be disappointed!

A gem of a brunch place. At first I only went here when the line at yolk was too long but now I go because I love some of the entrees so much. This morning I went and found no wait at eleven am which was a nice surprise. I ordered a farmers scramble- the eggs were perfect and the goat cheese on top was a nice compliment to the rest of the meal. I always have to get toast so I can use their home made jam. My wife got the French toast- I stole a piece- its what I think of when I think of good classic French toast. It is 3 thick pieces of challah bread that are soft and flavorful. We ask split a side of the chips. I love the ones that are crunchy and my wife loves the ones that are soft- something for everyone.

Best restaurant in Streeterville! My boyfriend and I come here 1-2 times a week since their food is so amazing (and because we live in the neighborhood). You can't go wrong with what your order. The grilled chicken sandwich is a must!

The service was excellent. We needed a split check and they handled it with ease. Some of the best chicken and cod we've ever had. Drinks totally hit the spot. We tried the chips and fries. Both were tasty. I recommend the fries with a meal, but the chips for sharing.

Great chicken pot pie. The bar is always a nice chilled place to sit and have informal banter with the bar staff and watch a game on TV. The added benefit of this traditionally decorated Irish pub is that's across the driveway from my home . Happy hour offers some great pulled poor sliders which always go down well and far too fast ! My only issue is their definition of Shepherds Pie . It's made with beef . Traditionally, cottage pie is the correct name when with beef and shepherds pie when made with lamb ( shepherds heard sheep not cows , as far as I have ever seen ). Defo worth a meal and drink stop here . Enjoy !
Shepard pie the worst in the country! Wait time was over 40 min. Then the server ignored me after I talked to the manager. Just terrible!

My friend and I were in the neighborhood and looking for a place to eat for lunch. We went around 2pm and were seated right away. The first thing I noticed was the charming decor of the Irish Pub. It felt very cozy with the burning fireplace on a rainy day. I got the small order of fish and chips. It was a huge portion for the small order. It included 2 large pieces of fried fish and a plateful of fries. The fish was good, but I didn't care for the batter. I thought it was too thick. Overall, D4 has good service and atmosphere, but I wouldn't go back for the food.

Two words: CHICKEN TENDERS.  They are seriously THE most crispy and fried chicken tenders I have ever consumed in my entire life. It comes with three different sauces, all of which taste great. It's also a huge portion! I ordered it with the intention of ordering another entree, but I just ended up eating half the chicken tenders, and the other half ended up being shared among the rest of my party.

I've been to D4 probably more than a hundred times by now over the four years that I've lived in Chicago. There were times where I'd come here once a week because it's close to where I work and live. I love D4 because its always consistent with the food: the food always comes out good. Just order the right things. Most of the time my friends and I split the chicken fingers and short rib nachos. Chicken fingers are huge and super crispy. The nachos are amazing; chips are crispy and loaded with toppings. Fish tacos are another great option. If some are feeling especially hungry, the D4 burger is a great option. Go with sweet potato fries instead of regular for a twist. The chicken pot pie is another favorite. I usually pass on the desserts here. The cocktails arent as fancy as other places in River North but if youre looking for an after work beer or cocktail its perfect. Moscow mules are on point. Theres a great selection of beers. Never had a problem with service. Dont know how I'd get by without this place!

Such an awesome find!!! This place has a fantastic atmosphere and the food here is legit! Came here for Saint Patrick's Day and the Bangers and Mash, Shepard's  Pie and Corn beef and Cabbage was to die for! The staff was also very friendly and on their game! Drinks and food are fairly priced with it being in Chicago, but exactly what we expected. We will definitely be back!

Very good place!  I've gone here twice so far.  I'm going to rate it 5 stars for now because we have got nothing but great service and great food!  My father moved close to this restaurant so I'm sure I will be back.  As of now we have tried 4 entrees: Chicken pot pie (a special that may not always be available), baby lamb chops (from the 'small plate menu'), chicken tenders, & Irish stew (again, this may be a special / seasonal option).  Everything has been great!  They offer an Irish brown bread which is good with butter and seems authentic; however, isn't my favorite in terms of bread taste and texture.  I have also had a couple cocktails and all have been good! It has a nice ambiance.  It is a bit dimly lit, but,  it isn't like a 'romantic' place.  It has many great seating options and a large bar. Their pricing is pretty standard.  Some things were actually amazing well priced.  Their 'Small plate' chicken tenders is HUGE!  I believe I got 5 huge tenders and 3 dipping sauces (pictures included).  I took half home and the server gave me take home containers of the sauces.  That 'small plate' could have been split between two with a couple drinks and maybe an appetizer. If you're in the area, I'd say give them a try!

The ambience is decent , the people here are pretty friendly. Would recommend red headed mule and the emerald mint martini if you want a cocktail and like it sweet.  I also recommend the fries and curry. Took off one star because they serve something called fried cauliflower which shouldn't be even on the menu.

Pretty decent option for lunch. Complimentary bread was quite tasty. The crabcake sliders unfortunately tasted very imitation like. If you are a true crabcake fan, skip this. Service was spotty. This is probably a better option if looking for just drinks.

So good, all around! I thought the food was pricey when I looked it up online, but the portions are huge! Service was absolutely fantastic, even we we went (day of the St. Patrick's day parade). Honestly blown away.

So I come down to River East quite a bit. I never noticed this restaurant so close by to where I usually hang out. It was pretty late at night, and we had already paid for quite a bit of time for parking. Our group didn't want to go home yet, so we stopped on in to D4. First of all, I did not think this place was going to be so big. There is more than enough space to hang with a large group of people, at the bar or at a table.  We decided to order some drinks and dessert. I also ordered the soup of the day. I was excited that they had Founders Rubaeus on the menu (bottled). They have a great selection of beer and whiskey. The soup that I ordered was cream of asparagus. I am a soup fiend, but my soup was way too salty. I still ate it all because, well, I am a soup fiend.  The desserts were okay, but the molten cake was not warm when it came out.  Service was totally fine, and overall it was a comfy spot to hang. I will have to come back here one day and try more things on the menu. I might have better luck food-wise if I stop in a bit earlier in the day. I'm not giving up on D4 just yet!
Always a top spot - everything here is amazing. Especially love the short rib/pickled jalapeño nachos, Shepard pie, fish chips!  I order as much delivery as going in with friends.

Holy smokes that was a good brunch!! Stopped in for a Bloody Mary and food while waiting for my dog to get groomed down the street. So glad I did!! Bloody Mary was killer (with bacon!) and the garden scramble was a total hit. Even the toast was amazing. I left full and happy.

Great food! Good Irish-style brown bread to start. The chopped salad had everything a good salad should, and my corned beef sandwich could probably feed two people. Excellent service, friendly, attentive and fast. I've eaten here several times, and they haven't missed yet.

Good place to go eat! I do not think it is much of an upscale Irish pub but I think it is a fine upscale restaurant. D4 sells items that are Irish in nature (like an Irish coffee and fish and chip) but it also sells items not Irish in nature (burrata). I enjoyed the food and I thought it was good, I also really enjoyed the drinks and service here! I think this a good place to go on any evening. We also had a very large group and the service was very good!

This normally our favorite place to eat.  We were there last Friday and had dinner.  My son and I ordered the corned beef sandwich and my husband ordered the Shepard's pie.  All excellent.  Ordered the same exact thing today for lunch, all off of the same menu at the same dinner price,  and received a lunch portion.  Very disappointing.  Why would I want to pay $18.00 for a small lunch sandwich when I can pay the same price at dinner for a HUGE one pound sandwich,  which is what it says the size is.... One pound.

Great ambiance and mules! Service was outstanding and appetizers/small plates were adequate! We tried lobster mac, turkey meatballs, loaded nachos, none of which would bring me back but the atmosphere made up for it and look forward to trying other food options.

We love this place for dinner (breakfast is a little bit hot and miss). We used to live just across the street and would get take out all the time. The hamburger is awesome. My brother still talks about it from when he visited a couple years ago. Chicken sandwich is awesome. Pulled pork is great. Turkey sandwich also great. O and the steak Caesar salad is one of my favorites. Probably the best I've ever had. SO GOOD.

I went here last evening around 5:15 when it was barely the start of dinner service. I told the hostess we may have a third so she took us to a table for 2 Huh? I said, "Where shall our third person sit if they come?" She seemed genuinely perplexed so I said, "We'll sit here" motioning to the four top.  Our server was nice while taking our drink order which consisted of one mock tail.  As we sat for about 10 minutes without the drink or without placing our order, I waved to her as she was at the bar talking with the bartender and another employee. She turned away from me. When another waitress came out to join the employee conversation at the bar I waved again, she tapped our waitress and spoke to her trying to get her to turn towards our table and our waitress resisted?! I really couldn't believe my eyes, so I got up and went to their group and said we needed to order as it had been a while and I got a patronizing reply that she was waiting for the drink to be made.  Out third person did show up and we got the D4 burger, chicken salad and turkey pastrami sandwich. The turkey pastrami was more like something you'd get at a fast food restaurant with a pile of processed lunch meat on it and an overwhelmingly mustard based coleslaw.   With so many great restaurants in the area this will be my last time here.
The food is delicious and the location and decor is excellent. However, the service is lacking and the staff looks and acts so incredibly unhappy. The vibe here is really not that great.

Has decent food each time, have tried the fish tacos, crab sliders, fish and chips and they have all been good. Not exceptional. For dessert have tried the chocolate lava cake and bread pudding and both are great!

Stopped by for a quick pint of the black stuff on the way back from Navy Pier. Ended up staying for hours! Lawrence behind the bar made me feel very welcome and the regulars too. Also the best quality pint of Guinness I've had in Chicago. The food looked good and there was plenty of it.

Went here expecting typical bar food (fries, burgers), which were on the menu, but also ended up ordering a delicious burrata and tomato salad and and curry mussels( would highly recommend the mussels!) Great romantic atmosphere, nice furnishings and friendly service. Would definitely recommend for dinner or drinks! Large room and not overly crowded.

Stopped in on taco Tuesday - what a bargain...and tasty!  We got pollo, veggie, bistec (beef), and carniatas tacos - one each, and topped it off with an apple crumble, and that was a nice meal. For drinks I had a freshly made margarita and my wife had a couple of glasses of a decent Cabernet.   Service was very efficient and accommodating. There was a variety of folks there, from families, to groups, to couples. Food came quickly and was fresh and very good. We'll try it again next time we're in town.

There were several things I dislike abt my experience 1. When we came in they gave us the small plates to pass around. 2 plates in the middle were completely dirty. 2. We asked for student discount but they only gave to students in UChicago or Northwestern. Which is lame because students everywhere are students. The food was average. The waitress who served us was okay at the beginning but not too nice at the end. I will not come back.

I just wanted to update my first review from 3 to 4 stars. I have since been here many times and I always enjoy it. All of the food is solid - I especially want to call out the D4 Burger which is one of the best burgers I've had in Chicago actually. I love the seasoning and the pretzel bun and it is always juicy and cooked properly. The patio is great for when the weather is warm and the inside is nicely decorated and cozy for those cold month. Overall, a solid option if you want some casual food in Streeterville.

Was in town for a girls week end. Stopped by for breakfast with 5 women, a 11year old and s two year old. Immediately greeted by the hostess and brought right to our table. Beautiful eating area, lots of dark wood. Waiter ( sorry I am horrible with names, but younger gentleman from Mexico) wAs fantastic. Brought a basket of bread and jam our immediately for the two young ones who were starving, who left us women indulged in a few Recommended Bee Sting Martinis( defiantly my next brunch drink). Food was outstanding. Fried egg, green tomato and bacon breakfast sandwich was delicious. Most certainly will be back.
The eggs benedict and the Irish breakfast was incredible the service was terrific. Amazing

This has become my go-to spot for a quick, affordable meal in the downtown area. We walked in on a Saturday night during peak dinner hours and were seated right away. The ambiance is nice {classic, cozy, dimly lit restaurant with a central bar}, and the wreathes and ornaments really gave the restaurant a warm, holiday feel during my most recent visit. There's a wide selection of beer, wine, and cocktails. The menu items are pretty standard, and the portions are enormous. I usually order the veggie burger - their house made veggie patties are delicious, especially when topped with avocado and  hummus yogurt.  Tip: Northwestern students get a 20% discount on their food and drink Great place to go if you're looking for some decent American food (or if you have a big appetite and forgot to make dinner plans).

Great place for brunch! our family of 5 stopped in on our first trip to Chicago and loved the experience. Kid friendly and delicious food. Wonderful service! Worth a stop in... you won't be disappointed!

Stopped in when I was visiting in Chicago last month during the baseball playoffs.  Only had a few beers so I can't comment on the food. Pretty good draft and bottle list.  Plenty of space and lots of TVs.  A good place to watch games.  I'd go back.
Great quiet place. We didn't want to wait in line for Yolk so we walked over here and got seated immediately. Cool atmosphere and amazing brunch.  Smoked salmon Benedict was incredible.
We live in the building next to D4 and have made this a place to get regular drinks. Food is decent and drinks are good. Staff is usually pretty friendly but not always the most timely.

Sitting down at the bar we were immediately greeted and given a menu, that's where the goodness ends!!! We waited for 15 minutes to be talked to again. At least 4 other groups came in and sat down and were served even drinks before we were talked to again. This is even after the female bartender/hop looked at us multiple times. Tried to get her attention and was ignored!!  My buddy lives down the block and he was more than not happy at the poor service after he talked this place up.

We wanted a non insane place to eat food and watch the Cubs World Series game. We came here and told them when they sat us that we wanted to watch the game. Let me preface this with this is not a sports bar so I guess we had unrealistic expectations. We were sat in the dining area where there were 1 or 2 TVs. It was uncomfortably hot in the restaurant. We went back to the hostess and asked if there was a spot in the bar area. There kind of was but again poor view of the tv and also still miserably hot. So we left, which is unfortunate because the menu looked good. I will have to come back another time. However, I hope it's not super hot inside- sooo uncomfortable (this also played a big role in why we left)

D4 is our "goto" neighborhood place.  It is an up scale Irish Pub.  We are always comfortable and enjoy the atmosphere and the food.  We often bring guests.  The burger is good, the salmon entree and the salmon salad are excellent. I like the shepherds pie - sometimes.  Unfortunately this seems to be inconsistent.  I'm told that it depends on the chef which is too bad not to know what to expect.  When it is good, it is excellent! Overall We're happy to have such a great neighborhood place and we will be back!  It is an excellent restaurant and bar.

My wife and I just had lunch here. Great atmosphere and great food. Beautifully decorated and quiet (I like quiet). Classy but not too fancy. Very comfortable. Great selection of food with some interesting dishes. I would definitely recommend it.

First off, the atmosphere is fabulous.  Secondly, they seated a party of seven for Sunday brunch.  Our drinks and coffee can very quickly and our server Jimmy was quick to refill our coffee when we required.  The food was excellent.  I got the Sunrise breakfast with turkey sausage and some of the best sourdough toast I have had.  Everyone at the table raved about their breakfast (including three children).  The prices are very reasonable for downtown Chicago.  Overall, I am very pleased with my brunch experience here and would definitely recommend this place to anyone who wants a great brunch experience.

We are in Chicago for a wedding and this was close to our hotel. The food was good, large portions even with the appetizers. Two people can easily share. The waitstaff were attentive. The drink prices are a bit high but it is worth trying out.
Great breakfast spot with huge portions.  Bloody Mary's were delicious, would definitely go their again.

I have eaten here a few times within the past few months and although I keep going back in hopes that I get an okay hot meal, the food never comes out as good as I hope. I took a leap of faith and ordered the Lobster Mac and Cheese to go and it was by far the WORST Lobster Mac and Cheese I have ever had....so bad I couldn't even eat it, which was disappointing because since the weather has been cooler lately, for some reason all I want is some GOOD Mac and Cheese. Every time I order out from D4, the food is always soggy by the time I get back and open the box to eat. I dont live far, just a few minutes so i dont understand why the food is already so soggy... When you eat in, the food comes out normal which is why I am giving 3 stars. They do have a very good salad that i would recommend (for take out or dine in), its the Chopped Chicken, which i highly recommend.

OMG! Hands down the best fish and chips that I've had outside of Ireland! My wife ordered the chicken pot pie, and she loved it. The portions were huge, and the meal was reasonably priced too. We will definitely return!

If I could put 0 Stars I would.  Yesterday I tried to eat at D4 with my wife, and the OWNER himself (Brendan McNeal), refused to serve/seat us because we have a ligament service animal, we even just wanted to sit outside. Completely illegal to do under the United States Department of Justice Civil Rights Division, and I explained that to him under law I do not need a piece of paper nor do i have to display on my dog that it is a service animal.  ada.gov/service_animals_…   HE DID NOT FOLLOW ANY OF THESE RULES.  and i quote... A. When it is not obvious what service an animal provides, only limited inquiries are allowed. (1) is the dog a service animal required because of a disability, and  (2) what work or task has the dog been trained to perform.  Staff cannot ask about the person's disability, require medical documentation, require a special identification card or training documentation for the dog, or ask that the dog demonstrate its ability to perform the work or task. B. Establishments that sell or prepare food must allow service animals in public areas even if state or local health codes prohibit animals on the premises. So to you Brendan McNeal, shame on you for discriminating against the disabled. I know it you could care less, but I will never eat or drink there ever again.  Carma is a bitch.

I was looking for a light breakfast so I opted for the oatmeal, which I would normally never go for but decided to give it a try. Mixed with brown sugar,  granola, and fresh berries it was GREAT!!!!! Hubby had the Smoked Salmon Benedict and he said it was one of his top 5 breakfasts ever!! Outdoor patio seating was quick, nice and shaded, and the service was EXCELLENT!!!

Had an absolutely superb experience here.  I chaperoned a moderately sized group on a weekday afternoon for lunch. Everything was executed perfectly and the staff was wonderful and accommodating.  Highly recommend D4 if you're in the area; for date night, a small group gathering or a large group gathering.  You won't be disappointed.
Had a grilled chicken sandwich with their house bacon glazed chips with Cajun spices. Service was good. Would suggest!

Since moving back to the neighborhood, I go to D-4 more frequently. Friendly conversation and interesting people always at the bar, and the smaller room with cafe tables and fireplace is my poetry writing room. There is also a library with a fireplace, great for parties. I love the food. I love the sliders. My favorite is the well-stuffed and flavorful crabmeat slider. The salmon salad is an artist's delilght with a huge piece of the most delicious salmon I've eaten anywhere in the city. This place IS my neighborhood/family home away from home. However, I think even random travellers would delight in its beauty, casual elegance, service, and decor. It is a lovely looking cafe/pub, but homey and welcoming, not stilted. It is my favorite place to eat, to write, and to hang out. I love the warmth of the people who work there.

Nice spot for brunch, happy hour, dinner, you name it! I have stopped in for both brunch and dinner before, both were very tasty. For brunch, I tried the French toast with berries. For only $10 and no wait to get in, this was a great brunch option in Streeterville. For dinner, the salads are tasty but a little pricy. If you work/study at northwestern, wildcard members get a discount. Great modern pub atmosphere with nice outdoor seating options.

Sunday morning, my wife and I walked from our hotel to Yolk for breakfast only to find they were on a 1 hour wait. Just 100 ft away, I spotted D4 Irish Pub with a "serving brunch" flag outside, so we walked over. Surprisingly, there was no wait. I don't want to bore you with a long story so I'll just be quick and to the point. The food was spectacular and the service was impeccable. Both my wife and I ordered the Huevos Rancheros. They might as well call themselves "D4 Mexican Pub." The food was outstandingly tasty with authentic flavors, and spicy! I never had an empty cup of coffee. The staff was friendly and very attentive. I even asked to speak with the manager on the way out to compliment our first experience. We will be back again to try their dinner menu, you can count on that!

Very good. For lunch I ordered the chicken sandwich, which I highly recommend. The only thing that wasn't good was the bread that came out before the meal. However, there was enough food for my lunch entre that I didn't need bread to fill up anyway.

The d4 burger has to be a favorite. Lobster roll also make for good eating.The decor is cool and I really want to give this place 5 stars. The staff are very unfriendly. If management could get on top of their staff or hire people that want to work in hospitality they would be well on their way to being a 5!

This is our favorite neighborhood spot. We come at least once every other week. They update their menu and beer selection seasonally so we're able to try something new every time we come. The chicken fingers are one of a kind but honestly everything on the menu is good. Great beer and cocktail selection too. Overall, this is a friendly, delicious neighborhood staple that I hope is around for many more years to come.

This review is long over due as I've been coming to D4 for a few years now and it's one of my favorite restaurants in Chicago!  So many things to talk about but first things first... the food!  I've never been disappointed by a meal at D4.  I'm a former (long time) vegetarian recently turned meat eater and so I've enjoyed everything from the veggie omelette to the steak salad.  My absolute favorites are the grilled cheese bites (with fontina, smoked gouda, havarti, caramelized onion on sourdough), the french opinion soup, and the D4 Eggs Benedict which comes with corn beef hash (I was skeptical of this at first but after turning back into a carnivore after 16 years and taking my first bite of this benedict, there was no turning back... I order it every time I'm there for brunch now and it's amazing!).  And the breakfast potatoes are awesome, too!  If you're there for brunch and order something with toast, you won't want to miss their homemade jam. As for ambiance, it's one of my favorite things about D4.  The restaurant is very large and spacious and even though it's a casual and relaxed atmosphere, the decor is sophisticated and lovely- very visually pleasing.  They have a fireplace in the back room, which looks like a historic library/study and you can also rent this space out for private parties/events.  They even have flat screen tv's for the sports fans (although the place does not resemble a sports bar) and they are not overbearing for those who aren't interested in looking up at a tv screen.      The staff here is great.  Friendly, fast service.  Excellent drinks and in the winter they have an awesome variety of seasonal drinks.  If you like a good bloody mary, definitely don't pass that up... and you'll get all the works with it (almost a meal in itself)!  And speaking of brunch, on the weekends (when you can't get in anywhere else because it's so crowded) D4 will most likely have less of a wait time.  People wait in a huge line for Yolk across the street and I think most don't realize that only a few steps away is an even better and less genaric brunch.  Lastly, they have outdoor seating in the spring/summer which is always a plus in Chicago!

This place is in my neighborhood and I wish it could feel like everybody knew my name. NO one knows your name and the staff turns over so quickly it wouldn't matter. They don't even to care about building  a local or regular clientele. They are very unaccommodating. So sad.

We stumbled in here (probably similar to many others) because Yolk had a million year wait on a Saturday morning.  I'm going to say it- there's a reason Yolk has a line and this place doesn't.  I got French toast that was honestly more Instagram-worthy than tasty. And pops got an average breakfast meal that's size didn't match the price tag.  Service was also atrocious for the place not being particularly crowded.

Did I really join YELP just to give this place a negative review? Yes. Yes I did.  Used to love this place.  Venue itself is great as well as the drinks.  However, for the love of God, DO NOT DO AN EVENT HERE!  DO NOT DEAL WITH MANAGEMENT HERE! Planned a birthday party of about 25 guests.  Booked the venue over the course of phone conversations and email correspondence a week in advance.  Received multiple confirmations via phone and email that my deal was set.   I planned a $30 wristband package from 9-11 pm. When I arrived at the venue nothing was set.  My guests weren't seated until 9:15 and the manager on duty said the deal wasn't in place although I had all the correspondence proving otherwise.  At that point, rather than have my guests wait I just  wound up placing the entire event on my card.  They even had the gall to charge me for going over the allotted time even though they weren't even ready.  There were no apologies from the management and nothing was done to rectify their poor organizational skills.  They didn't even have the courtesy to respond to an email I sent after the event to explain themselves. Thus I've resorted to the lowest common denominator--creating a yelp account to publicly antagonize this amateur operation.   Just a very unprofessional experience.  Don't go here!

Came here for a work lunch and was impressed by the space and food. Great selection for higher end bar food. I had the caprese salad sandwich with shoe string fries which was good. Reliable bar food when you're in the area. They also have a happy hour which unfortunately we could not partake in.

Terrible.  Been here a dozen or so times.  Service is never good - not once.  Only have returned because it's near work and co-worker going away parties keep being planned here. It's safe to say that's over after last night. Staff and management are horrendous - and I'm fairly certain they have a particular aversion to a certain demographic.

I have never posted a review but went tonight with my significant other and we got there at 955 and left at 1015 after never being served. Never being acknowledged, given water etc. I live in neighborhood and have gone multiple times and was looking forward to a late night meal but was quite disappointed with the service tonight

Ate here with a colleague on 7/16/16 for dinner. The atmosphere has a very good vibe. I ordered the bourbon glazed salmon. Very good. He ordered the fish tacos and said they were bland and the fish was chewy. I would done here again to try other menu items.

Absolutely love this place!  This is our neighborhood pub and we have be here about 10 times.  The owner is always there walking around making sure customers are pleased and there food is so delish... especially the fish and chips and chicken crispers.  Yum!
Great option if you want to skip the line at Yolk & have some cocktails. Fish Tacos, Chicken Pot Pie & Sliders are amazing.

Came here for the drinks and food. Had a sangria, maple bacon chips and short Ribbon nachos.  Loved the maple bacon chips.  Not too big on the bacon stuff but this was delish. The nachos were delish too. The short ribs were soft.  Great place for food and drinks. Great portions and prices are good.

Got the smoked salmon and Dragon's Milk Stout.  It was awesome.  The smoked salmon was great.  Great service and recommendations from Max.  My colleague got the crab cake sliders... Very tasty.  You can't go wrong to come here.

Check the photo for review. Great food. The Shepherd's Pie was a generous portion and paired well with a Guinness Blonde...especially if you are not a fan of hoppy beers! Don't miss the salted caramel ice cream! We actually had dinner here before the fireworks at Navy Pier on the 4th of July and stopped back in after the fireworks for a cold beer to let the traffic subside. The bartenders are great!
Cute place. Bartenders were friendly. The food smelled good although we didn't try anything because we had recently eaten dinner. I'd like to come back and try the food.

My hubs and I are in town for a conference, and decided to hit up a local place he loved last time he was here. I understand now why he loved it. We went to D4 for brunch, and were seated outside, where the intrepid and inspired waiter, Juan, served us some seriously good brunch fare. I ordered the Pink St. Germain, a light and citrusy cocktail that went perfectly with my smoked salmon platter. My husband got the D4 Benedict: eggs benedict, with thinly sliced corned beef instead of Canadian bacon and a slice of heirloom tomato. As much as I enjoyed my salmon, his platter won the day. I'd happily eat a plateful every morning, finances permitting. The service was spectacular. The food was incredible. The entire experience started our vacation off right!
I love their nachos and fish and chips.  The portions are enormous and not at too bad of a price for streeterville.  I always have a good meal with nice service.

D4 is such a great Irish bar and restaurant. We love coming here when we are in the area. During the summer, it has a cute little outdoor patio where you can enjoy drinks and delicious food. My favorite item on the menu are the fish and chips. The portion is generous and the fish is on par. A lot of times when you order fish and chip, the fish is basically are batter. At D4 the batter is amazing, but there is plenty of fish! I also like to order the bread pudding. I usually have to get that to go because I'm so full by the end of the meal. The brunch is awesome too! I've had a few of their ciders, although I'm not a huge beer drinker. I'm a fan of their specialty cocktails though. The interior is very authentic and pub-like with large booths, high tops, and lots of seating. Can't wait to go back!

Been here twice so far (maybe a year apart?) and I loved it both times.  First time was dinner; this time, brunch with the Eating Machine (18yo son) on a gorgeous Saturday in June. We live down the street from Wildberry on Randolph, so that was our original destination.  9am on BluesFest/America'sCup weekend, so.... wait time was 1.5 hrs.  No thanks.  Walked up Michigan & then east on Ohio (&south on whatever [McClurg Ct?] cuz entrance is actually on Grand) to hit Yolk (one of their 6 gabillion Chicago locations) and knew in an instant the wait would be just as long.  (Neither place, while fine establishments, are worth a 1.5 hr wait in 90degree heat.  Trust me, I've eaten at both plenty of times.) Heading back towards Michigan, we saw D4 & their brunch sign.  The son was ready to chew off his arm, so he quickly agreed to D4 without even checking the menu. Hash & 2 Eggs for me; D4 burger w/fries for him.  OMG, the homemade hash!!! Corned beef hash, but not that mushy nightmare-in-a-can from my childhood.  This is yummy, tender, made-with-love REAL corned beef (that they also serve as a sandwich) mixed with diced potatoes ... as my son said, "This is my new favorite restaurant!" Really a great place. Although Yolk and (to a lesser extent) Wildberry are good places -- Wildberry's service has been less than cordial *every* visit ... and I'm ridiculously cheerful to waitstaff cuz I've been one -- from now on D4 will be our target destination, with Yolk as a backup.
Love this place! Service is excellent and the food is wonderful. Their cocktail list is unique and crafted beautify. Love the atmosphere so we come here whenever we are in Chicago

huge place about halfway between michigan ave. & navy pier with very good food and great service.  the interior is very well done, lots of attention to detail that i am sure did not come cheap.  whether it's the tremendously done back bar with it's classic styling & wooden features, the nicely done b/w tiled floor, or the long bar with 20+ large round padded stools, larger wooden bar top & bar face with extra details and a brass foot rest.  opposite the bar are some two seat high top tables in the walkway, then high top eating tables along the windows that look out to ohio st. (unfortunately not much to see other than a parking & embassy suites).  beyond the bar is a small room with lower eating tables.  atmosphere is more upscale than other irish pubs.  D4 is super close to timothy o'tooles & definitely worth checking out if there or in the area.
Reasonably priced and they have good drink options. It's kind of "laid-back lame", but so is every other place in Streeterville. If you're in the area it's definitely a good option for a pint.
Considering options around the area, I would pass on this one based on ambiance, quality and service.

I came here awhile back for a coworker's going away happy hour. The hot drinks were wonderful on a cold late winter evening (I had some magical chocolate mint tastiness).  But, almost all of our glasses had visible lip marks on them, and the women's restroom didn't have a single stall with a hook on it. In the middle of winter with coats and purses, not having a coat hook on any stall is highly annoying.  One extra star for the wildcard discount, and the server for splitting our check in a huge party.

D4 serves up tasty salads, sandwiches and entrees. The lobster mac & cheese, lemon roasted 1/2 chicken and short rib sandwich are some high notes. *Note: the short rib sandwich is not on the menu, currently. @D4-Can you bring this back or is this seasonal?

The owner and managers are really rude: it is surprising and embarrassing!! The food is fine. The price is ok (about average).  I have been several times. Some friends had organized periodically private and professional events. With them we organized a couple of events with 20-30 people until late 2015. Both the manager and even the owner were *really rude* (it was embarrassing!!): they were not happy enough to have all those people periodically but they expected them to order immediately (without even giving time to greet and introduce each other, and without making sure that somebody brought menus). Everybody ordered in average a full meal and a beer. After that, they started to demand money for the reservation and a minimum order per person (maybe 30$ or more...I don't remember...). The waiter the first time complained that she was not able to give individual bills. The overall feeling was just that we were clearly not welcome! Apparently the don't value or need loyal customers who periodically bring groups of people. So we found a better restaurant first and a more appropriate location later. I have never personally been there again...and never will be...! There are many other places that are less arrogant with better quality / price ratio. But apparently the traffic of people and occasional customers in the area is enough for the pub not to care about loyal customers, publicity and quality. UPDATE (may 2016): the owner kindly apologized in a private message after my review. I appreciate that.

Great service! Menu selection is perfect...not to much but plenty to choose from. Loaded tater tots are great as an appetizer.  Shepherds pie was great. Try the Ace Pear Ale, never heard of it before but quite tasty.

This place has a pretty good brunch menu and wonderful drink options. It's a large open space but not too overwhelming. The friend had gotten a pulled pork sandwich which was hearty and huge among itself--(passerby table observed with glee and ordered the same). I ended up getting a selection of items because I was not too hungry. Got some eggs, potatoes, and a bagel and cream cheese with jelly. I think they make their own jelly (not sure) but that was delicious! Came another day for a cocktail and after a day of walking around the city, it was nice to cool down with this drink. It was a grapefruit peppercorn old fashioned. This was done so well! It had bourbon, grapefruit bitters, peppercorns, grapefruit zest, and basil. Wow! They seem to have a pretty solid menu for lunch and some specials throughout the week. If I'm around the area, I'd be sure to check it out. Sitting at the bar is very chill and the bartenders are very attentive and friendly. I liked this place!

My aunt and uncle have held a few celebratory events here: most recently a cousin's First Communion this afternoon. This time they had a reserved space in a separate room. The owner came by and checked on us, even before my aunt or uncle made it back from the ceremony. I thought that was a nice touch. He seems like a very nice man who is dedicated to his business and to his clients. The brogue doesn't hurt. ;) We had a party of 20-25, including children. "Reserved" placards and menus were already set out for us, as were cutlery, water, and water glasses. Waitstaff was attentive and service was on point. Our entire party (minus the kids, of course) was brought champagne to toast my second youngest cousin on her first communion. I'm not sure if my uncle set this up, but it was a great touch. I ordered: Delirium (on tap!) - $9 Verdict: This had waaay too much head (both times). (FYI: Bloodies are pretty good! They include generous toppings and a strip of bacon. When in doubt, order one of those.) Chopped Chicken Salad - $14 Generous size with lots of delicious, obviously hand-pulled chicken - both white and dark meat. Feta, avocado, tomatoes, seeds = YUM! ..but the dates?! They contributed a sweetness that I wasn't a fan of. Portion sizes were HUGE all the way around, actually, especially the sandwiches:  Fish and Chips are HUGE. Turkey and Chicken sammies are HUGE.  The ONLY exception was the pancakes. My 11 year-old cousin ordered the Pancakes and received 3 standard-sized. At $9, a bit steep, dontchathink? (Luckily I wasn't footing the bill..) To sum: D4 has great service, great flavors, and MOSTLY great portion sizes, minus $3 pp (Per Pancake).
Quite tasty. My meal wasn't quite as good as everyone else I was with - but they loved it.

The chopped chicken salad was good!  Very slow service. We waited a good 10 minutes just for someone to greet us and take our order. After our order was placed on our table, the server went MIA. We had to flag down 2 different people just to get extra ketchup and the bill.  Don't think I'll be rushing back anytime soon...

This place has a great brunch with a short wait. Lunch and dinner are decent. I like the sliders and fish tacos. Late night happy hour at 10pm. The ambiance is cute and much better than most of the other bars in the neighborhood. If you have a colleague or date that you want to grab a quick drink with, this is the best place in the neighborhood unless it's nice enough to sit on the patio at Pinstripes

My lady and I were staying at the Hotel InterContinental Magnificent Mile up the street and were looking for a uncrowded upscale brunch spot after attending church at Holy Name Cathedral. We realized this might be challenging on Sunday downtown with nice weather. This proved correct as Yolk on East Ohio Street was a loud chaotic scene with a 45-minute wait, so we walked around the corner only to discover D4, which promptly became our new favorite brunch spot. They are billed as an Irish Pub & Cafe, but exceed that description. Here's why: We were greeted immediately at the door by a friendly host who found us a quiet table for two in a perfect spot out of direct sunlight overlooking the flowered landscaping. He seated us promptly and brought two glasses for chilled water, which came in a clear glass bottle with stopper, a classy touch. Our server quickly brought menus, which were clean, uncomplicated and organized, another classy touch. Clean tables, comfortable chairs with white linen napkins, yet more classiness. We ordered and our food arrived promptly despite the venue being busy, about two-thirds full. My lady had the vegetarian omelet with goat cheese and spinach, which came with home-style baked potato rounds and sliced avacado. All the ingredients were fresh and tasty, and she remarked that it was the best omelet she had ever had. I tried a few fork-fulls and would agree, it was excellent. I had the salmon eggs benedict, which was equally fresh and delicious, not fishy tasting and the English muffins were not Thomas store bought like at so many other restaurants. The hollandaise sauce was appropriate for salmon, creamy but not heavy, a balanced taste and not too much of it. The eggs were large cage free fresh and perfectly poached. I could easily cut through all the different layers which made eating it a pleasure rather than a chore. I've eaten a lot of eggs benedict and this is the best one I've had with salmon. We also enjoyed cups of coffee, a good quality brew that is not trying too hard by attempting to compete with the chic coffee house brands, which too many other breakfast places make the mistake of, not perceiving that you're there for the food and ambience. The coffee mugs were large white porcelain with indented middles that made them easier to hold, another thoughtful touch. My lady was impressed that they offered Pure Via natural sweetener on the table, and our server attentively refilled our cups twice. We never felt rushed, crowded, hassled or ignored as can so easily happen during peak service periods in downtown venues. The check was brought out promptly and the total bill was surprisingly reasonable for an expensive town like Chicago at about $36; we left a 25% tip, which we felt was well deserved by their whole team. I lived in the Chicago area for 20 years before relocating back to Buffalo NY and wish I had found this place sooner, which opened in 2007. Their chef is clearly talented, management knows what they are doing, and the staff is superbly trained. The setting is away from the crowded intersection and traffic noise, so you can have a pleasant conversation without shouting. D4 was nothing but excellent. For this experience, they earned a rare 5 stars from us and we will be back for breakfast as well as lunch. I would give D4's people a 6th star for their great attitude if I could. And we're not even Irish!

I am a big fan of this place.  Hidden with the two big housing towers this is a great option.  The food is very good and they also deliver to my place via grubhub when I am super lazy to walk for 5 minutes :)

This place has a cool, cozy atmosphere, great drink options, and attentive staff. Their menu changes a lot, but everything they come up with is very good!  Also, since it's Irish, it's a great choice during St. Pat's week for people who want a little authentic(ish) Irish food and drink without the trashy debauchery and plastic shamrocks that Chicago already has sooooo much of elsewhere.

eat brunch here. just do it. the side room with the fireplace is a room that I will probably try to replicate in my future home. that includes all the random books they keep on the shelves that line the entire wall opposite the windows. I could easily lose myself in a book in a place like that. it's totally normal to hang out in a bar instead of a cafe right? coffee... irish coffee... what's the difference?

Slightly snooty, friendly smiles, somewhat serious. 'tis D4. The patrons, including many regulars, appear to be of the upper business class. It's definitely and generally a Streeterville professional crowd of nearby residents. Suit jackets are not required. LOL This said, the people really are nice and friendly! I enjoy D4. It's a calm vibe, the staff is terrific, welcoming, well trained, attentive, professional and buttoned up. It has a warm feel. The bar itself is gorgeous. Very well done. Hat's off to the owner, who is also a regular presence in the establishment. I also admire his integrity and respectful pride; Policy: Refuse the sale of the so called, "Irish-Car-Bomb." You can't get that uncouth, tasteless drink here. Great News:  Guinness Draught and Harp; available by the barrel! ~Cheers!

I love D4. Great food (way better than you'll get at other Irish bars in town), a real Irish brunch, and a great cider selection. They have warm winter cocktails too. Always a good vibe in there and the staff is really friendly.

Cozy restaurant with a fireplace and bookshelves that provide a homey feel along with food that warms you up especially from the cold Chicago winds. The chicken fingers are amazing, especially the curry yogurt sauce. Portions are huge; I ordered the D4 burger, which was delicious - and comes on a pretzel bun! There are also a lot of TV's for watching games or sporting events in the bar area.

I got the caesar salad, which was an excellent value for how large it was. The drink menu selection is good, and there is room to handle a larger group if you have 10-20 people.  Note to Northwestern students - show your wildcard to get a discount.

Last night would not have been as fun if it was not for this place! Definitely the place to go on parade day. Chicago turns up for St. Patties! They had an awesome set-up outside. It was packed inside but it was a big restaurant so there was still a lot of space to move around. The limited menu wasn't vegetarian friendly but our server had the kitchen make my friend a grilled cheese so that was nice.Our server was great too. She told us she had been there since 8 am (It was 6pm) but she was still friendly and pretty funny!! I just moved to Chicago but I will definitely be back again to try it out on a much less crazier night. Good job on parade day!

Very offended on my experience. Apologies for trying to order an offensive drink "Irish  carbomb" but no need to refuse service and tell me to "fuck off". When we chose you for our 3rd drink of the evening, we expected better. After getting offended by "Jacob" the bartender that offended us, we got to talk to "James" the bar manager. He could care less how we were treated and told us to leave if we were offended.  We asked the hosted how to escalate our concern when security came over, gave us out money back, and asked us to leave to not cause issues.  Apologies again for ordering an offensive drink.

Music is horrible! And food... Don't get started there! Refused to accommodate vegetarians and vegans on st. Pattys. I understand it's a busy day but how hard is it to make grilled cheese or a veggie patty! And music! Come on! Spotify playlists are better than what's playing!
If u are a vegetarian and hungry don't come here. They do not do modifications and will only serve you potato products

I love Irish food, so I hate to give this a bad review! But I must. I went there with some friends last week. We asked what the best thing on the menu was, and our server told us it was the chicken pot pie. We ordered a chicken salad, a chicken pot pie, a shepard's pie, some kids menu items, and drinks.  The salad came out first, and my friends noticed that the chicken tasted funny. They described it as old left-over rotisserie chicken on a salad. Seemed strange. Then we got the chicken pot pie, and it was horrible! It had this strange awful sour/metallic taste. We told our waitress and she simply said she would notify the chef. No apology for serving us a really bad dinner which was expensive; not an offer of anything else; and didn't take it off our bill! Granted, we ate half the pie, because we were hungry, and we weren't sure what the best course of action was, and we were slowly getting more disgusted with each passing bite. Finally we just decided to stop forcing ourselves to eat it, and when she came to take it we explained what was wrong. We felt certain that it was really old chicken in both the pot pie and on the salad. It's not like the server made the personal decision to serve old gross chicken, but as the face between the front/back house, she should have tried to make us have a good experience for a $100+ bill. The shepard's pie was fine, and so were the kids menu items (not too difficult there).  I have to give 1 star because we won't be going back. We had to pay $100+ to have a really bad meal with either old or rancid chicken, and we told them about it, and they basically acted like they didn't care. We went home worried about getting sick. Luckily we didn't.

Love this place. It's laid back and casual, yet the food is sooo good. Not just a really good Irish restaurant.. just a great one overall! My favorite item on the menu is the kale grapefruit salad, but just about everything I've tried is amazing. The service is usually friendly, and the ambiance is a perfect for a relaxed afternoon or evening.

Not sure why people will wait for a table at yolk for 1.5hrs+ when this restaurant is just as delicious and right next door. With usually no wait. D4 also takes reservations!  They have a very tasty brunch. My husband and I have gone here a few times. They have a good selection of savory and sweet brunch items. As well a a good brunch cocktail menu. Their mimosas are only $7!  The ambiance is really fun too. One side has a bar feel and the other a restaurant. They have tvs on one side too. We haven't gone here during a game, but I'm sure it gets packed.
Just came in here for a quick beer. Got my tab $9 of a half full Delirium Tremens. Really?  Wow. Over over priced. Go to Timothy O' Toole's. At least the prices are in line

Came here with a friend for brunch this morning.  There was plenty of seating available and no wait for a Sunday brunch during prime time.  The staff was friendly, and the atmosphere was warm and cozy, especially next to the fireplace.  We both ordered the smoked salmon eggs benedict, which came with thick cut potato chips and generally was a tasty option.  I opted for the Bellini, and my friend ordered the Bloody Mary, both of which were great.  For one drink and a meal, the price was $27 - a little overpriced in my opinion for the overall experience.

We were in Chicago for a long weekend recently and honestly stumbled upon this place. Like many, we were heading for Yolk, but the line was out the door so we moved on. We were there for a Sunday brunch, and surprisingly it wasn't packed at all. There was a steady crowd, but I think the slightly higher price probably leaves some looking elsewhere for Brunch. The decor in the restaurant is very sophisticated for an Irish Pub kind of place. Very high ceilings, large bookcases on the wall, overall a very relaxing, yet refined environment.  The homemade jam at the table is some of the best I have had. This is a must with your side of toast. As far as the meal goes, I had the corn beef hash eggs Benedict, and it was very tasty. My other half wasn't very impressed by the omelette, but I tried it and it was decent.  Service was above average, and we would come back here in a heartbeat. Definitely worth checking out, especially if you find the line out the door at Yolk.

Great neighborhood spot. The food is wonderful and drink menu has something for everyone (Alpha King on tap!!!!)  Only complaint is the manager seems to hover over the bar staff - who are already doing their jobs well. So we get asked the same questions twice.

I was expecting a lot out of this place but honestly it was a let down. The Chicken fingers which they're know for were okay at best. The service we got was sub-par at best and it took almost 20 minutes to receive our bill. I would understand if they were really busy but they weren't. It was almost like our waitress didn't want to deal with us because we were clearly the youngest couple in the bar. That's too bad because I typically tip in the 25% range. The only reason I gave three stars is because they had Three Floyds on tap.
One of the grossest things while dining out is being served a glass with lipstick from a previous customer on it. Out of the 3 glasses on our table, ALL 3 had lipstick on them. Blah!

Veal meatballs are extremely savory and full of flavor. Slight spice on the end but sweet in the middle. The tomato sauce is very good. It has a hint of cinnamon!  Love it. The Heirloom on the other hand was ok. The tomatoes for being February were good but the olives were still seeded. Although a decent salad in terms of flavor picking out the seeds were a pain in the rear.   Bartenders are great, atmosphere is awesome. More of an upscale Irish Pub. Definitely would recommend and come back!

Awesome service.. great food... Good Times... Surprisingly it's a good place for vegans too.. they have a couple very good vegan options.. lucky for me, my friend got me to this place.. wish it showed up for my vegan sort in yelp by itself.. so I am not sure who should put in a little extra effort - yelp or restaurant guys? So that it shows up in the vegan sort..  Kale salad was phenomenal Nachos - exceptional Flat bread - pretty good Burger - ok, nothing to brag about... All in all .. good place.. Will certainly see you guys again..

Enjoyed this place with a nice cider and hot chocolate. It was close to DoubleTree I stayed, nice Christmas decorations at that time, whole bar area looked interesting. Hard to find a table in the evening, so we just sat at the bar. Overall it was refreshing to stop by and get a drink.
Love the atmosphere here. I went there on Wed night, and ordered chicken pie. Delicious! It will be crowded on weekend night.
Great atmosphere! Our server Devon was awesome. I'm here visiting a friend for the weekend but I will definitely be back !!

Had a great casual, cozy evening in front of the fireplace. The BF wanted fish and chips so it was a natural choice.  I had the half chicken which was enormous, and very good:) Our server was terrific! Will def go back as we want to explore some other meals... And dessert !!!!

This place is one of my new favorites! The drinks were nice and I had the short rib nachos and they were the bomb!!!! So good! The service was really good, Juan did great! He made me a chocolate martini that was to die for! I definitely had a good time with the girls for a nice lunch! It wasn't too pricey either so it really did not disappoint!

Nice place! I love Irish pubs though so maybe biased. I was here at opening on a Friday (11 am) just got a few beers before a movie (1 block away). They have 16 beers on tap. Bartender is very friendly. Huge menu that looks very good (I'm also told it's good). Brunch is only on wkds and reportedly better than the Yolk restaurant next door that often has a wait. Will definitely come again.

I have eaten here a few times so far. The food is consistently good as is the service. They have interesting fare, not just typical pub food. I love their kale salad with grapefruit dressing. My mom loves their fish and chips ($10 on Sunday nights), and even their whiskeys I've had are generously poured. We also tried a specialty dish one night of trout with lentils. Also very good and healthy. I am reserving my 5-star rating after I try most of the things on their menu. But I do plan on making this my go-to place in the neighborhood.

We came her for NYE dinner and this place was amazing! The best lobster corn chowder! Atmosphere was good too. Food was great. The only thing I didn't like was their corned beef sandwich because it was way too dry. This place is highly recommended. We'll definitely visit again.

It is conveniently located for Navy Pier activities and I stopped in there after a show.  The atmosphere is very nice with much attention paid to the elaborate bar and flooring.  I had some drinks and appetizers and enjoyed the warmth of a Irish pub on a cold night.  Everything I experienced was excellent during my visit.

Located at the bottom of a residential high rise what D4 lacks in bud light bottles (I really like bud light bottles) it more than makes up for in rich decor and a few pulls of smithwicks. Nowhere near honorable mention is their food, specifically their highly addictive chicken fingers and BBQ pork. It's a true public house, meaning they will serve you when they serve you while you enjoy your food and drink. Key word: enjoy. Take that for what it's worth. Classy decorations at Christmas time. This place won't disappoint for a starting hole or dinner before the nights adventure begins.
Love this place! Such a great vibe at this classy irish pub. With good food and a great beer selection like 3 Floyds Gumballhead on tap you can't go wrong.

I'm only giving this place one star and that's because it's a beautiful bar.  My husband and I just walked in to enquire about breakfast and were very rudely greeted by all staff. Saying that they weren't open yet for 12 minutes by one staff member, 17 minutes from another who then changed to 20 min. The doors were open and we weren't the only people walking in looking for breakfast. The whole staff was snobbish and rude, which I would expect from a nightclub in LA, but not a pub in Chicago. Really disappointed as I would've liked to come back for dinner/drinks while we are in town. I'll be spending my money somewhere else now.
I've probably tried 8-10 different items off their menu and all were delicious! But what really keeps me coming back with the bread pudding.

Took a quick trip to Chicago with my girlfriend. Ate breakfast here. This was place was really nice on the inside. I liked their bar it was huge and really nice. Our service was just ok but the place was busy due to a 5k that just finished up. So I will give the service a pass. Both our breakfast dishes were really good. I had the omelette which I highly recommend. My girlfriend had the French toast which looked amazing. The portions were enormous so bring a good appetite. I wish I had dinner there and a few drinks. Judging by previous comments dinner here sounds amazing. I will be making a trip here next time. Good job D4 Irish Pub!

This place is a MUST in Chicago. Our family went with another family and we had the most pleasant experience. Our waiter was absolutely accommodating. He did such a fantastic job of making sure our kids were happy. And when kids are happy, the parents are too ;).  Food is fantastic. The kids had chicken fingers, Mac and cheese bites And Tator tots with bacon and cheese. All came out hot and fresh. The fingers have to be the best in the city. My husband and a friend had the burgers and both loved them. I had a chicken chipped salad and it was also delicious. If you're the type who likes a lot of dressing, I recommend asking for more on the side. I found my salad a little lacking of the dressing but it's about personal preference. And I do recommend their ranch. It's delicious! My other friend had the pork sandwich and it was different and delicious. Different in a good way. The bbq was rich and flavorful. My husband got a beer with Left hand milk stout with chambord. That drink was so good. It was like a party in your mouth! I recommend ordering it!  And our waiter then brought out ice cream for the kids so the adults could have another beverage. This place gets it. It's kids friendly but there is also a bar and a part of the restaurant where we could come back without kids and still have fun! Great atmosphere, fantastic service and the food was some of the best in the city.

We were looking for a late night dinner and D4 was the perfect restaurant close to Michigan Avenue. The restaurant is very cozy with the black and white checkered cafe floor, brassy light fixtures and a fireplace in the back room. We ordered from the "late night menu" and had the grilled cheese triangles and chopped chicken salad. The menu has many comfort food items and I would also recommend coming back weekdays from 4-6pm for their happy hour menu. When my friend said we were going to an Irish place, I was thinking it would be more pub fare. I was surprised to find that D4 is more of a cafe with a cozy setting and very tasty food. I also learned that D4 is a district in Dublin and that is where the names comes from. If you are shopping or staying near Michigan Avenue, D4 is a great place to stop on Ohio street and refuel with drinks, a cozy fire and comfort food.
Excellent food. Great service. Good seating availability. Very nice food and bar menu. Prices were very reasonable for the generous portion size.  Definitely would go back.

I'm a frequent client to this bar. I think it is one of the best local Irish bars in the neighborhood & in Chicago in general.  The atmosphere is great. It's refreshing in summer, cosy during winter with a fire place that gives warmth to the surroundings. The food is great, especially the sweet potato fries. The chicken sandwich is one of my favorites. The prices are really reasonable. It is a highly recommended place to go to. Also, breakfast is delicious and sweet.

Ordered the corned beef sandwich, pretty dry and bland although a lot of beef. My wife ordered the lobster roll. Should have been called a lobster salad roll since it was a cold sandwich with celery and onions mixed in. Not what we expected. Had a caramel mule which was pretty smooth.

Visited D4 for a few Saturday afternoon cocktails with a group of 6. Nice selection of beers and craft cocktails. The strawberry basil martinis were to die for!  I didn't give 5 stars because it seemed a tad short staffed and we were told we couldn't split the checks. Regardless I would definitely come back!

I am literally sitting in this restaurant at 2pm on a Sunday in the middle of brunch and some employee has been vacuuming for the last 7 minutes around the whole restaurant. No one can hear anyone else talking. Very obnoxious  please stop.

My husband and I live nearby and are always looking for a new spot to grab a bite.  Before going to AMC East we found D4 nearby and decided to give it a try.  It was so cozy warm without being too hot.   The food was what you would expect from an Irish pub, and delicious.  All the comfort foods, with a nice variety of salads too. Portions are generous.  Love this place, will definitely go back.  Would also be a great place for a drink and dessert  by the fireplace in the winter.
Pretty cool place in river north. The food was decent. We got fish and chips and the fish tacos which were both solid choices... Nothing spectacular but definitely a good dependable option.

I'm just going to say that the sweet coconut curry dip for the Curry Chips is incredible. I never would have thought it would be this good. Holy Moley! I had a chicken salad and the Curry Chips. Big portions. I'm full and I didn't finish. All was really good, but that curry!!! Unreal.

My husband and I love D4!   We live nearby in the Streeterville neighborhood and D4 is always a go-to place for us... very comfortable and cozy atmosphere, with a nice mix of friendly people.   The service is consistently excellent and attentive, and the food and the beer/cocktail selections are great.   We always recommend D4 to friends who are looking for a more upscale but yet still casual place to go to in the Near North area.
This place had great service and perfect outdoor seating. The drinks and food were all delicious and perfect atmosphere brunch.

YUM. Seriously. After seeing the huge wait outside Yolk down the street, I made a last minute reservation for brunch at D4 and was happy that I did. Strolling around hungover on a Sunday morning called for a lot of coffee and water, which D4 quickly provided while we perused the menu. The smoked salmon caught my eye as it is difficult for my to turn down. It was served as three large swirls atop cream cheese and (here's the weird part) toast. I supposed this was an Irish twist but it was good nonetheless. Plenty of capers, tomatoes, onions and a hard boiled egg made this the perfect breakfast. The rest of our group got French toast, Benedicts, or veggie omelets, which they all devoured as well.
